storyInfo: The Eye of Iberia is rekindled, and the conspiracy in Gran Faro seems to be drawing to a close. The ocean is always touching this land, pushing everything into the abyss.

attributes.content: Can't wait any longer?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: If what Kal'tsit said was true, then none of us can really afford to wait around.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Even while we walk this land, we are still a part of the sea. Those corrupted descendants are... in the process of changing the 'environment.'
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: In time, none of us will be spared. All we're doing now is sitting around waiting for the end to come.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: We're not the only ones sitting around though, and everyone's reasons are different.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Think about it more broadly. Who knows, maybe these lands aren't suited for our survival?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: (Riffs in agreement)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Not harmonious enough.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: There's something I wanna try.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Time to mix it up, all for the tunes!
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: (Riffs in agreement)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: So what exactly do you have in mind?
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Uh... Well, we're not exactly accomplishing much over here.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Just treat it as a little pre-concert workout. Don't swim too far out, Frost.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: A workout. Huh. What about the rest of you?
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: I think I'll pass.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Too lazy.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: I can feel the inspiration on its way. It's so close. Just a liiittle bit more.
attributes.name: Dan

attributes.content: ...Alright. (Riffs enthusiastically)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: I'll be off then.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: No, what did that woman and the Inquisitor do? How could they so easily erase the gift of the sea?!
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: Ægir... It must've been the Ægir. What the Ægir left behind, those strange machines! They must be destroyed!
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: (Makes a slithering sound as it clings to the cultist's calves)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: That's right, my brother, the Penal Battalion has this place surrounded, and we've failed to break through... We've nowhere to run.
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: But... our exalted prophet has returned to the sea.
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: All that's left... is to pave the way for Her.
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: (Impatient slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: If they seek to hold back the tide, then let them dash against the rocks. My life is but one brick in a lengthy road.
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Cultist

attributes.content: Eek!
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: Don't panic, it's just me. Why haven't you taken refuge yet?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: M-Mayor Thiago... I was drunk and out as cold as a gloompincer, so I didn't hear anything.
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: By the time I woke up, everything had gone to shit, and these disgusting things were all over the place.
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: What happened here? Has the Inquisition sent anyone yet? What's going to happen to us?
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: ...The great ocean is not guilty of any crime, but the Inquisition does not agree. They control the so-called law, and have condemned us as sinners.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Soon enough, the Sea Terrors will return to the ocean. But I cannot allow the Inquisitors to condemn Gran Faro to death just like that.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: What are you talking about? Have you gone mad?
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: Mad? I'm not the one who's mad! I simply need to know! What can we do before the Inquisition destroys this town and rounds us all up to stand trial?!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: An Inquisitor has already arrived. I saw that clearly when hiding in a little alley. I've never seen one that old before, and they gave me the chills...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: What are you gonna do then, Thiago? Go up to them and try to reason with them?
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: We'll have to choose sides again, right?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: When the Ægir were taken away, most people looked on, just like that. They had a chance to stand up for them, but nobody stepped forward.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago, you—
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: Now, we have another chance. Either watch the Inquisition put everyone in Gran Faro on trial, or—
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Have you lost your marbles?! Inquisitor! Hey, Inquisitor! He can handle us all without raising a hand!
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: Take me to them.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: Drop the act. How long do you think I've lived in this town?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Alright, follow me. If your goal really is to take revenge on the Inquisitors...
attributes.name: Terrified Townsperson

attributes.content: Just what are you up to, Mayor Thiago?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Almost there.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: This is already taking too long.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: S-Sorry.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's not your fault. It's mine, for not having enough patience.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Um... Doña Inquisitor, if you're worried about the others, you can go help them. I think I can handle things up here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The High Inquisitor gave me a order to protect you. As you've seen, those monsters are everywhere. I can't just leave you alone.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But I don't want to be what's holding you back from joining the battle... I just—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: As long as you can light up this tower, then the High Inquisitor will have made the correct decision. I simply defer to his judgment.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Did your knowledge of the Eye of Iberia come from your parents?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Yes. Or more precisely, it's the sum of all of Gran Faro's past. They gathered all the best lighthouse engineers in all of Iberia, or at least that's what my uncle told me.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The territory used to be demarcated by the Inquisition, until it was abandoned after a string of incidents involving the Ægir and the Church of the Deep.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I'm not trying to reopen old wounds, but I've been thinking. Before I left, I read the dossier about the sentence handed down at the time. ...No, never mind.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Do you hate the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Um... To be honest...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If there's anything that always hangs over the heads of the people back home, other than the ubiquitous dark clouds, it would be the word 'Inquisition.'
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The town once glimmered, giving us the confidence to rebuild our homes. The workers and engineers gave everything they had to fight the disaster, but the Inquisition took everything before it even struck.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: And do you still believe that today?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: It's the place I grew up in. Everything I've ever seen or heard has only reinforced that lesson.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: And, um, I'm sorry, ma'am.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You are simply stating your lived experiences, citizen. It is your actions that will prove your loyalty to Iberia.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Still, I'm astonished you had the guts to say all that in front of an Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I never would've dared, not until I came here... But, then I saw the Eye. For the longest time, it's only appeared in my dreams, nothing more than a sculpture sitting in the plaza.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Everyone in Gran Faro who came before me has passed this all down. Our duty, what we must do...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's all surging through me right now—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: —Um, ma'am, do you see something glimmering at the base of the lighthouse? Something blue, and sparkling like stars...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: —The nethersea brand!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Do you really think you can fight me, Mister Knight?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You only care about the lighthouse. Why? Why do you cling to it so?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Monstrous waves... Swallowing the sky...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: ...Even the stalk of wheat... consumed by silence. All things great and small... returned to nothing.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Agitated slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: He can speak, but not command his kin. The Sea Terrors are in disarray.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Let us put an end to this.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: (Rasping roar) —!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: —What a surprise, Mister Knight. You're not moving like you were before.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Those are human movements. A charging wind-up, unique to Kuranta knights. What exactly are you?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: The knight continues to ignore his two opponents. His attention is solely on the third.
Even with his attack, the towering lighthouse does not even shake. If even the Profound Silence failed to destroy the Eye, what chance does a lone knight have?
It bewilders him. It pushes him to try even harder.
(Rasping murmur) Clouds, rolling hills, pillars of ash... arrayed across a hotbed of decay.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The tides... unending...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Violent slithering)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: You're injured, and the Sea Terrors are drawn to you.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: So it appears. Got a little scratched up on accident—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ngh...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Step aside. You're no longer fit to fight.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Dario's eyes quickly dart across the Abyssal Hunter in front of him. Her movements had paused unnaturally a few times during the previous clash.
He's heard reports about her. She was involved in the Sal Viento experiments, but the woman who stands before him is completely different from the one who emerged from that fierce battle.
Who was she? And who is she now?
They've hardly touched you, yet you seem barely able to stand.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Maybe an illness you contracted in Sal Viento?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: ...The scent of the sea is rather intoxicating, that's all.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Knight ...Comrade. Why, why must you gag on the air, and endure the heat? You'll never taste... the fruits of civilization.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Urgh...!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The ground is shaking.
Energy long-lost floods through the pipelines and into the broken body of the Eye of Iberia, prying open its eyelids.
It has awakened. The entire island whispers the groans of its first light. Slowly it shakes off its winter, as if waking from centuries of hibernation.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...The cycle of all existence...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Does not belong to the sea...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The knight lifts his head, gazing up from the shadow beneath the great lighthouse.
He is perplexed.
That... is not the monstrous waves.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Where... are they?
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Without drawing a single breath, as naturally as a shadow slants in the direction of the light, Specter brings down her weapon.
But the humanoid Seaborn in front of her avoids it, with logic-defying explosive force.
In midair, the knight looks far out into the distance.
He is listening, listening for the coming of new waves. And he will break them.
...Ishar... mla...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Rasping growl) —Roci—nante—!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Braying) —!!
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: (Unintelligible sounds) Chase!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Turns out, Mister Knight is afraid of the light.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Don't pursue him. He's not the only Seaborn like that out there. Our only duty is to defend this lighthouse.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: He's only lost interest in the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I don't care about the motivations of monsters.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Are you saying... I'm also a monster?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You are undergoing a transformation. I don't know whether this is something that happens with every Abyssal Hunter.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: But if necessary, this reef will be the last bit of land you'll ever step on.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You would still call this land, when we're clearly surrounded by ocean?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Disasters change coastlines, not national boundaries.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Every last centimeter of land swallowed by the Profound Silence is still subject to the laws of Iberia.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Laws, a virtuous word. Yet not all creatures recognize this virtue.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Ready your blade.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: J-Just a little bit more!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (Slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Hurry up then! If this drags out any longer, the lighthouse will be swallowed up by the nethersea brand!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Ran into a little bit of a hitch!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: One of the auxiliary structures might've been damaged, b-but that would take too much time to investigate!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Just booting up the core facility will suffice. We still have to retrieve the flagship's coordinates, ideally reestablishing a connection with the line running along the coast—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I, I know, but— Those things might be even higher up!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Then keep going! Hurry!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I have to stay here... Turning on the lighthouse is as simple as pulling the most conspicuous lever, but I need to stay here and oversee the power system rebooting.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You should go, ma'am.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What? But if you're attacked by a Sea Terror that slipped through the net, we'll all—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I know! But I, I don't want to come up one step short, not now!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Those monsters— They only lashed out against humans because we invaded their nest, right?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If that's the case, they won't keep destroying the facilities. If anything, getting into a fight will only make things more dangerous, so you should keep climbing instead!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...A conspicuous lever, right?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Yeah, it should be obvious. Flip that, and at least the main facilities, including the lighting equipment, will start up again. ...Assuming what the log said is correct.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I'll be right back, Jordi.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The console... Well, this is it.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Nothing on the outside is visible from within the tower.
Could the Stultifera really not have sunk? How are they supposed to find that great dreadnought?
Is it too late for the Penal Battalion to come to their aid? Are the cultists of Gran Faro hiding even more secrets?
Just by pulling down on lever in her hand, all of these questions would be answered.
Irene should have been conflicted. She had accepted too much, learned much of the sea, and seen it all with her own eyes.
—Now's the time.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I hope you're ready, Irene.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Dazzling light penetrates the ocean, piercing through everything.
The light will lead the way. The light can dispel the darkness.
It worked!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hey, Jordi! Did you see that? We did it—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Slithering sounds, rubbing against the wall)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Merda...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I didn't think you still had it in you to appreciate this sculpture.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The Eye of Iberia... The offspring of the marriage between Ægir and Iberian technology. On land, each nomadic city can only seamlessly communicate within its own walls. Between cities, however, is like crossing a moat.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No system of communication can resolve the interference caused by Originium-rich zones. The only solution is to set up base stations that are at constant risk of being destroyed by Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I hear some countries have already adopted the technology of mobile base stations that navigate on a fixed route between cities. Their engineers are no different from those who guard our lighthouses.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Even today, humans still stumble about across this great land, blindly grasping for clues. We must still grope our way across Terra in near total darkness.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But, what of the ocean?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: There is no Originium in the ocean. The Ægir's communication technology vastly surpasses anything we have on land. The Eye of Iberia is not just a set of lighthouses.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It is, of course, Iberia's vision. Very few people know that it was left to us by Breogan, as a microphone to connect all of Iberia.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: It's been a while, sir.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: Your work was invaluable in allowing the Inquisition to respond so quickly to Dame Kal'tsit's proposal.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: How about you? Have you enjoyed your time in Gran Faro?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Compared to the other cities where our colleagues lay dormant, this place can hardly be considered dangerous.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: So, what have you found here?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: My sincere apologies, sir. I doubt I know much more than you and the Dame.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: The order given to me by the High Inquisitor was to monitor Gran Faro for more potential enemies, those who would violate our laws and desecrate our country.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: My conclusion being, no. Not for the time being.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: When the Church's cultists appeared, you didn't notify your team in time.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Correct, I determined those cultists to be impotent, and took advantage of the Penal Battalion's withdrawal as a prime opportunity to go after their true mastermind.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: And did you find them? Are there more... false bishops, presiding over the sea's invasion of the land?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Without concrete evidence, I can only speculate as to who their leader is.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: But Mayor Thiago, a worker from the Iberian hinterlands, is nominally the mayor of this town.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: Since the Eye of Iberia project was scrapped and the Inquisition made quick work of the traitors in Gran Faro, it's been no secret that he has been a pointed critic of the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: Thiago... One of Gran Faro's laborers, sheltering the cultists. It would seem we have our next target, Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: There's one other thing. Umm, Lord Carmen, the Penal Battalion seems to have come under attack.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: They've invested a Tercio just to quash the evil writhing in Gran Faro, to the point that it's a rare luxury to see even a single badge. What could they up against?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The nethersea brand has seeped through the ground to the surface, drawing a circle roughly fifty kilometers around Gran Faro.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: And, it's a perfect circle, almost as if it was drawn with a compass...
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: It's not the town that's been surrounded, though. It's us.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson
